segment.source: Split view
segment.target: Split view

segment.source: A split view control has an expandable/collapsible pane and a content area.
segment.target: A split view control has an expandable/collapsible pane and a content area.

segment.source: Guidelines for the split view control
segment.target: Guidelines for the split view control

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Important APIs
segment.target: Important APIs

segment.source: SplitView class (XAML)
segment.target: SplitView class (XAML)

segment.source: SplitView object (HTML)
segment.target: SplitView object (HTML)

segment.source: A split view control has an expandable/collapsible pane and a content area.
segment.target: A split view control has an expandable/collapsible pane and a content area.

segment.source: The content area is always visible.
segment.target: The content area is always visible.

segment.source: The pane can expand and collapse or remain in an open state, and can present itself from either the left side or right side of an app window.
segment.target: The pane can expand and collapse or remain in an open state, and can present itself from either the left side or right side of an app window.

segment.source: The pane has three modes:
segment.target: The pane has three modes:

segment.source: Overlay
segment.target: Overlay

segment.source: The pane is hidden until opened.
segment.target: The pane is hidden until opened.

segment.source: When open, the pane overlays the content area.
segment.target: When open, the pane overlays the content area.

segment.source: Inline
segment.target: Inline

segment.source: The pane is always visible and doesn't overlay the content area.
segment.target: The pane is always visible and doesn't overlay the content area.

segment.source: The pane and content areas divide the available screen real estate.
segment.target: The pane and content areas divide the available screen real estate.

segment.source: Compact
segment.target: Compact

segment.source: The pane is always visible in this mode, which is just wide enough to show icons (usually 48 epx wide).
segment.target: The pane is always visible in this mode, which is just wide enough to show icons (usually 48 epx wide).

segment.source: The pane and the content area divide the available screen real estate.
segment.target: The pane and the content area divide the available screen real estate.

segment.source: Although the standard compact mode doesn't overlay the content area, it can transform to a wider pane to show more content which will overlay the content area.
segment.target: Although the standard compact mode doesn't overlay the content area, it can transform to a wider pane to show more content which will overlay the content area.

segment.source: Is this the right control?
segment.target: Is this the right control?

segment.source: The split view control can be used to make a nav pane pattern.
segment.target: The split view control can be used to make a nav pane pattern.

segment.source: To build this pattern, add an expand/collapse button (the "hamburger" button) and a list view need to the split view control.
segment.target: To build this pattern, add an expand/collapse button (the "hamburger" button) and a list view need to the split view control.

segment.source: Examples
segment.target: Examples

segment.source: The split view control in its default form is a basic container.
segment.target: The split view control in its default form is a basic container.

segment.source: With a button and a list view added, the split view control is ready as a navigation menu.
segment.target: With a button and a list view added, the split view control is ready as a navigation menu.

segment.source: Here are examples of the split view as a navigation menu, in expanded and compact modes.
segment.target: Here are examples of the split view as a navigation menu, in expanded and compact modes.

segment.source: an example of a split view menu in overlay mode and compact mode
segment.target: an example of a split view menu in overlay mode and compact mode

segment.source: Recommendations
segment.target: Recommendations

segment.source: When using split view for a navigation menu, we recommend placing in the pane navigation controls that allow access to other areas of the app.
segment.target: When using split view for a navigation menu, we recommend placing in the pane navigation controls that allow access to other areas of the app.

segment.source: Using the pane for navigation provides a consistent user experience.
segment.target: Using the pane for navigation provides a consistent user experience.

segment.source: In addition, this menu implementation can help familiarize users to all parts of an app, provide quick access to the app's home page, and can encourage users to explore more areas of the app.
segment.target: In addition, this menu implementation can help familiarize users to all parts of an app, provide quick access to the app's home page, and can encourage users to explore more areas of the app.

segment.source: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.
segment.target: \[This article contains information that is specific to Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps and Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
segment.target: For Windows 8.1 guidance, please download the Windows 8.1 guidelines PDF.\]
